intro: Ulmus campestris var. argenteovariegata, commonly known as the silver-variegated elm, is a cultivar of the field elm. It is characterized by its distinctive variegated leaves that display white to yellow margins and a darker green center. The tree typically grows to a height of 15–25 meters and has a spreading, rounded canopy. Its bark is smooth and greyish-brown, becoming fissured with age. This cultivar is valued for its ornamental appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
